methods.description: Search for public or private channels in an Enterprise organization.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `admin.conversations:read`

parameters.name: teamIds
parameters.description: Comma separated string of team IDs, signifying the workspaces to search through.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Name of the the channel to query by.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to be returned. Must be between 1 - 20 both inclusive. Default is 10.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Set `cursor` to `next_cursor` returned by the previous call to list items in the next page.

parameters.name: searchChannelTypes
parameters.description: The type of channel to include or exclude in the search. For example `private` will search private channels, while `private_exclude` will exclude them. For a full list of types, check the [Types section](#types).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Possible values are `relevant` (search ranking based on what we think is closest), `name` (alphabetical), `member_count` (number of users in the channel), and `created` (date channel was created). You can optionally pair this with the `sort_dir` arg to change how it is sorted

parameters.name: sortDir
parameters.description: Sort direction. Possible values are `asc` for ascending order like (1, 2, 3) or (a, b, c), and `desc` for descending order like (3, 2, 1) or (c, b, a)

responses.description: Schema for successful response of admin.conversations.search
Schema for error response from admin.conversations.search

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `conversations:history`

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Conversation ID to fetch thread from.

parameters.name: ts
parameters.description: Unique identifier of a thread's parent message. `ts` must be the timestamp of an existing message with 0 or more replies. If there are no replies then just the single message referenced by `ts` will return - it is just an ordinary, unthreaded message.

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description: End of time range of messages to include in results.

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results.

parameters.name: inclusive
parameters.description: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results only when either timestamp is specified.

methods.description: List conversations the calling user may access.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `conversations:read`

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Browse conversations by a specific user ID's membership. Non-public channels are restricted to those where the calling user shares membership.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Mix and match channel types by providing a comma-separated list of any combination of `public_channel`, `private_channel`, `mpim`, `im`

parameters.name: excludeArchived
parameters.description: Set to `true` to exclude archived channels from the list

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the list hasn't been reached. Must be an integer no larger than 1000.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the `cursor` parameter to a `next_cursor` attribute returned by a previous request's `response_metadata`. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See [pagination](/docs/pagination) for more detail.

Providing no `limit` value will result in Slack attempting to deliver you the entire result set. If the collection is too large you may experience `limit_required` or HTTP 500 errors.

methods.description: Update an existing view.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `none`

parameters.name: viewId
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the view to be updated. Either `view_id` or `external_id` is required.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the view set by the developer. Must be unique for all views on a team. Max length of 255 characters. Either `view_id` or `external_id` is required.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: A [view object](/reference/surfaces/views). This must be a JSON-encoded string.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: A string that represents view state to protect against possible race conditions.

methods.description: Indicate that an app's step in a workflow completed execution.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `workflow.steps:execute`

parameters.name: workflowStepExecuteId
parameters.description: Context identifier that maps to the correct workflow step execution.

parameters.name: outputs
parameters.description: Key-value object of outputs from your step. Keys of this object reflect the configured `key` properties of your [`outputs`](/reference/workflows/workflow_step#output) array from your `workflow_step` object.

parameters.name: workflowStepExecuteId
parameters.description: Context identifier that maps to the correct workflow step execution.

This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

methods.description: Update the configuration for a workflow extension step.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `workflow.steps:execute`

parameters.name: workflowStepEditId
parameters.description: A context identifier provided with `view_submission` payloads used to call back to `workflows.updateStep`.

parameters.name: inputs
parameters.description: A JSON key-value map of inputs required from a user during configuration. This is the data your app expects to receive when the workflow step starts. **Please note**: the embedded variable format is set and replaced by the workflow system. You cannot create custom variables that will be replaced at runtime. [Read more about variables in workflow steps here](/workflows/steps#variables).

parameters.name: outputs
parameters.description: An JSON array of output objects used during step execution. This is the data your app agrees to provide when your workflow step was executed.

parameters.name: stepName
parameters.description: An optional field that can be used to override the step name that is shown in the Workflow Builder.

parameters.name: stepImageUrl
parameters.description: An optional field that can be used to override app image that is shown in the Workflow Builder.

responses.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.
This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

apiDescription: One way to interact with the Slack platform is its HTTP RPC-based Web API, a collection of methods requiring OAuth 2.0-based user, bot, or workspace tokens blessed with related OAuth scopes.
